title: E0282 Cannot infer type for type parameter None when trait wrapped in an Option

labels.name: A-diagnostics
labels.description: Area: Messages for errors, warnings, and lints

labels.name: T-compiler
labels.description: Relevant to the compiler team, which will review and decide on the PR/issue.

body:
<!--
Thank you for filing a bug report! 🐛 Please provide a short summary of the bug,
along with any information you feel relevant to replicating the bug.

If you cannot produce a minimal reproduction case (something that would work in
isolation), please provide the steps or even link to a repository that causes
the problematic output to occur.
-->

Given the following code: https://play.rust-lang.org/?version=stable&mode=debug&edition=2021&gist=c6854c9ab5cbec3fd53e788876b7fe08

```
pub trait Output {
    fn name(&self) -> String;
}

pub fn run(mut output_override: Option<Box<impl Output>>) -> () {

}

fn main() {
    // run(None::<Box<outputs::console_output::ConsoleOutput>>)
    run(None)
}
```

The current output is:

```
error[[E0282]](https://doc.rust-lang.org/stable/error-index.html#E0282): type annotations needed
  [--> src/main.rs:11:5
](https://play.rust-lang.org/?version=stable&mode=debug&edition=2021&gist=c6854c9ab5cbec3fd53e788876b7fe08#)   |
11 |     run(None)
   |     ^^^ cannot infer type for type parameter `impl Output` declared on the function `run`

For more information about this error, try `rustc --explain E0282`.
```

I had a few implementations of the Output trait I was confused that I could not just pass None as I felt the compiler should
detect the Option None value before looking at the trait for the run parameter

In the end I had to just pick one of my implementations to pass to run as a default which makes for unclear code
like

```
run(None::<Box<outputs::console_output::ConsoleOutput>>)
```
